result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Lee Spindler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5.  No contact directly or indirectly with the following persons:  Ricky Wood, William Hebel, Anthony Nelson, Kyle Wittig, Codie Hayden.
6.  Defendant shall furnish 80 hours of community service within the first 12 months of this agreement on a project approved by the C/S coordinator.
7) Defendant shall commit no probation violations.

records.addlTxt: Count 2 - Probation
Count 1

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of max. penalties on both charges.  Agreement reached.  DAGP State seeking to revoke with global agreement.  Count 1 in 16CM15 8 mos. jail with credit for 178 days.  In 16CF54, 8 mos. concurrent with 180 days credit.  Count 2 revoke DPA, 3 yrs. probation.  State notes PSI recommendation was 7-9 mos.  Her next step is prison.  In 16CF54 court imposes 8 mos jail with credit for 180 days.  In 16CM15, impose 8 mos. jail with credit for 178 days.  8 mos. is concurrent.  In count 2 of 16CF54 by stipulation, DAGPA revoked, judgment of guilty entered; withhold sentence and order 3 yrs probation.  On new felony impose $443 costs.  Unpaid costs in 16CF54 judgment granted. 16CM15 judgment for unpaid costs.  Conditions of probation, no possession or use of controlled substance.  Atty Hughes asks for 180 days credit in delivery charge.  Court will address at a later time if revoked.
Letter of Support for Amanda Spindler's Sentencing after Revocation
Withdrawn at this time.

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms motion to revoke still pending.  Atty Hughes informs she has companion case that is being revoked and will schedule both cases at same time.  State informs she's on PO hold pending revocation.  Matter cont'd.
Order to show cause hearing on September 4, 2018 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Steven Hughes appt'd.
Status conference on August 7, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Judge Duvall and Court Reporter appears by VCON from Buffalo County Courtroom.

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court.   Attorney Steven Hughes appears by phone means.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs defendant she is here on warrant for f/t/a on motion to revoke DPA for failure to do community service.  Court sees you have new charges in St. Croix County in which you were convicted but JOC not yet processed; minutes from yesterday you plead guilty to charge of count 2, resisting and count 3 possession of paraphernalia, count 1 dismissed, and sentenced.  Atty Seifert informs information from DOC is that they intend to revoke Pepin County probation case, she's on PO hold, she got time served in St. Croix County, ask for cash bond of $1000.  Atty Hughes did not know she was on PO hold, ask cash bond of $50 and didn't see on CCAP any incidents of her to failure to appear except for this most recent time but she called informing she didn't have a ride; she informs she moved back to her parents home in Durand.  Court inquires of her address.  W4613 Cty Rd B.  Atty Seifert informs Mr. Hughes his client is shaking her head no.  Defendant informs her address is W5552 US Hwy 10, Durand, WI 54736.  Court notes that is the address in 16CF54.  Court sets bond in amount of $1000 cash and set this for STC on 8/7 at 3 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
DPA revoked - Count 2

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler not in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion Hearing to Revoke DPA was set for 9:30 a.m., now 9:48 a.m.; notice of hearing was sent to her and she FTA.  State informs she called clerk's office and talked with Patty and said she didn't have a ride here.  State asks for warrant.  Court grants motion to revoke to get matter back in active status and authorize warrant.
Motion hearing on April 30, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Motion to Revoke DAGP
Bond refunded

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Kayla M Rodriguez.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead NC to count 2 and enter into DPA.  State informs Information filed 2/21/17 and need a plea before enter into DPA.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 2 as stated in the Information, maximum penalties, felony prohibitions, and constitutional rights.  Court reviews the DPA with the defendant, failure to comply with the agreement and compliance with the agreement.  To the charge of delivery of meth as charged in Information, defendant pleads no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, withholds accepting plea and approves DPA.  Counsel requests bond be released.  Court authorizes release of bond to person who posted.
Plea hearing on January 8, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Motion hearing on February 5, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Final pre-trial on February 20, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on March 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Kayla M Rodriguez.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court received Ms. Rodriguez letter on nature of the DPA as true Deferred Agreement.  Counsel had discussions with DA and DA w/withdraw motion to revoke and continue with Deferred Agrmt. for 2 yrs. including community service.  Court notes letter from DOC with significant violations, inquires if more appropriate to convert Deferred Agrmt. to DPA.  State notes at previous hearing court wondered why P&P were not revoking her but went along with addt'l jail.   Court notes if accept agreement today, can't promptly respond to violation, want to be ready to respond, if convert to DPA she has no trial rights; won't put her back on C/S on that case but could use it on the probation case.  Off record for counsel to discuss with her client.  On record.  Atty Rodriguez informs she has talked with her client and won't enter a plea at this time.  Court informs if uncomfortable doing that, the alternative is revoking the agreement and set matter for trial.  Cousel requests to talk with her client again.  Off record.  On record.  Counsel has talked with her client again and will not enter a plea today.  Court informs counsel to file motions within 30 days and advises defendant of max. penalties of $25,000 fine and 12 1/2 yrs. in prison.  State wishes to address bond as defendant in jail until Jan. 10th, request $1000 cash bond based upon the facts.  Atty Rodriguez asks court to reissue the signature bond as defendant still on probation, is in the CCS program through Human Services and doing AODA and mental health treatment.  Court sets $1000 cash bond as the $500 signature bond was not enough; notes the allegation is a delivery charge and concerned with public safety; she continues to use controlled substance, was terminated from treatment program in the community in Sept. 2017; in October 2017 completed inpatient treatment but failed outpatient; failed to keep in contact with P&P; failed to keep her approved residence.
Letter to Court re: Dec 11 hearing
Notice of Completion of Representation of Melissa Petersen
Amended Motion to Revoke DPA

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court received letter from DOC and inquires why she is not being revoked.  State filed a Motion to Revoke the DPA failure to comply with community service.  Atty Peterson informs the DPA indicated to complete 80 hours within 12 months, the year isn't done yet so she still has time to complete it.  Court notes she was to complete 8 hrs/mo. and completion date was extended and she has not done 8 hrs/mo.  Court notes State's motion does not indicate a probation violation was a violation of the DPA and inquires if the State will be amending its motion.  Mr. Seifert indicates yes.  Atty Peterson requests additional time as that was not raised in his motion; has no objection to the DOC request.  Court amends condition of probation on misdemeanor case to add additional 59 days conditional jail com. today w/huber for assessment or treatment.  Counsel to get a MH date on motion to revoke for failure to do community service and failure to comply with probation, new probation violation.

Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes defendant on probation for 2 misdemeanors but only 1 case on calendar for today.  Count 2 in 16CF54 remains unresolved, State was either to dismiss or file DPA but neither happened.  Atty Hillestad informs the Court he received the DPA from Mr. Seifert doesn't have it with him.  State informs he continues to extend DPA.  State presents DPA to Atty Hillestad.  Off record.  On record.  Atty Hillestad presents DPA to the Court.  Preliminary hearing previously waived on 1/30.  State has 30 days in which to file the Information, can process DPA after receipt.  Approve the DPA on Count 2.  On count 1 DOC requests 30 days conditional jail.  State believes appropriate.  Atty Hillestad informs she admitted she used, denies the drugs were hers.  Believes treatment appropriate...  Court modifies probation on count 1 in 16CF54 to add an addt'l 60 days conditional jail com. 2/7/17 and credit for any inpatient residential treatment; modifies time limits on community service; identify project by 5/1; complete all hours by 3/30/18.
Information Filed
Probation review hearing on February 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Letter from DOC

Defendant appears with Attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon Seifert appears on behalf of the S/W.  Agreement reached.  State w/amend count 1 to 946.41, count 2 DPA; will plead to count 1 in 16CM15.  Court advises defendant of charge in 16CM15/max. penalties; count 2 in 16CF54/max penalties.  Defendant waives right to PH on Count 2.  Court shows WOPH & binds defendant over on meth charge.  DA to complete DPA paperwork and file it within 2 weeks.  To criminal damage to property in 16CM15, defendant pleads guilty.  To amended charge Obstructing an officer, defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and pleas done K&V, accepts pleas & finds defendant guilty on those 2 counts.  Court withholds sentence & places defendant on 2 yrs. probation w/conditions; advised of appeal rights.
Preliminary hearing on January 30, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Atty Roger Hillestad appointed.
Preliminary hearing on January 10, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Amanda Lee Spindler in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $500 cash bond.  Atty Smith requests Sign. Bond, she appeared here today.  Court sets a $500 bond, can be posted by cash or her father sign as surety as guarantee with conditions:  reside with your father; no violations of law; appear for all court dates; comply with any requested drug testing.  Preliminary Hrg. requested within time limits.
